dtliExcerpt: Fun summer movies are being turned into dreary summer theater this August. The tone-deaf “Back to the Future” musical is now followed by “The Shark Is Broken,” written by Ian Shaw and Joseph Nixon, which tells the behind-the-scenes story of the making of “Jaws.”

keyPhrases.quote: Fun summer movies are being turned into dreary summer theater
The tone-deaf 'Back to the Future' musical is now followed by 'The Shark Is Broken'

llmScore.reasoning: Claude: The critic uses strongly negative language ('dreary', 'tone-deaf') and groups this show with another they've clearly panned, suggesting a pattern of disappointing movie-to-theater adaptations.
